Sebastien let out a low, dark laugh—the kind that sent shivers down spines when it wasn’t muffled by a phone.

**"Oh, *babe*,"** he purred, voice dripping with mock sympathy. **"You think I won’t?"**

A pause. Then—fabric rustling again, the sound of keys jingling in the background.

**"I’ve got your roommate Jen’s number saved from last year’s student council mixer."** Another laugh—softer this time, almost playful if not for the razor edge beneath it. **"How fast do you think she'd unlock the door if I told her there was an *emergency meeting* about your scholarship status?"**

The line went quiet for a beat—letting that threat sink in before his tone shifted again: colder now, stripped of all pretense.

**"So here's what's gonna happen."** His voice dropped to a whisper so rough it scraped against her ears like gravel. **"You're going to hang up this phone… walk out that door… and meet me at my place in twenty minutes." A sharp inhale—like he was savoring the taste of victory already.** **"Or I swear to god, Hailee, I will make sure every single person on this campus knows exactly how much you love begging for my cock by sunrise."**

Another pause—long enough for her to imagine his smirk through the silence before he added sweetly:

***"...Tick-tock, darling."***

name: Sebastien
mes:
The line went dead before Sebastien could respond—*click*.

For a moment, there was only silence on his end. Then—

A *crack* as his phone shattered against the wall of his pristine apartment.

His chest heaved, knuckles white where they gripped the edge of his desk. The golden boy facade had finally slipped, revealing something raw and ugly beneath—something he hadn’t let anyone see in years. Not since he was a child begging for scraps of attention from parents who only loved him when he performed perfectly.

And now *she* was leaving too? After everything? After all the times he’d made her scream his name like a prayer? After all the bruises he’d painted on her skin like signatures of ownership?

No. No, no, *no.*

Sebastien snatched up his keys with trembling fingers, storming toward the door before stopping dead in his tracks. His reflection in the hallway mirror caught him off guard—hair disheveled, tie loose, eyes wild with something dangerously close to panic. He looked… unraveled. Weak. *Pathetic.* Just like his father always said he would be if he ever let someone matter too much.

His breath hitched.

Then—slowly, deliberately—he straightened his tie.

Smoothed back his hair.

Schooled every flicker of emotion back behind that flawless mask until nothing remained but cool indifference.

If Hailee wanted to play this game? Fine.
He'd make sure she regretted it more than anything in her life.

By tomorrow morning?
She'd be crawling back to him on her knees.
Begging for forgiveness.
And this time?
He wouldn't give it so easily...

For a moment, there was nothing but silence on his end—just the faint sound of his own breathing, uneven and sharp. Then—

**Click.**

His phone hit the wall with enough force to crack the screen, glass splintering like spiderwebs across his reflection. His chest rose and fell in quick, shallow bursts as he stared at it, fingers flexing at his sides like he wanted to break something else. *Anything* else.

A beat passed. Then another.

And then—laughter. Dark, humorless laughter spilled from his lips as he dragged a hand down his face, shoulders shaking with it like he’d just heard the funniest fucking joke in the world.

**"Oh… oh *wow*."** He exhaled sharply through gritted teeth before turning toward the door—already reaching for his keys again with trembling fingers because no way in *hell* was this ending like this—not after everything they'd been through together (not when she belonged to him). But then… hesitation struck him mid-step when reality finally sank its claws into him: she had hung up on him first this time instead of caving immediately as usual... which meant... which meant...

His breath hitched audibly before rage swallowed whatever fragile emotion had tried clawing its way out from beneath all that carefully constructed control (because if anyone asked? There wasn't anything fragile about Sebastien Lie). Jaw clenched tight enough that pain radiated up into temples now too; veins standing out along forearms where fists were clenched so hard nails bit crescent moons into palms raw-red already from earlier today's frustrations alone--

But none of that mattered right now because one thing remained crystal clear amidst all these swirling emotions threatening drown him whole:

He wasn't letting go without one last fight (and maybe bloodshed).

So without another thought wasted debating consequences or reputations anymore? He grabbed jacket off hook by doorway while simultaneously typing rapid-fire message onto new phone pulled spare drawer--

> **"10 minutes or I come get u myself."**
> **"Don’t test me tonight Hailee."**
> **"U won’t like how it ends if u do."**

The line went dead before Sebastien could respond—*click*.

For a moment, there was only silence. Then—

A sharp *crack* as his phone shattered against the wall of his penthouse apartment. Glass scattered across marble like fallen stars. His chest heaved, knuckles white where they gripped the edge of his desk hard enough to splinter wood beneath polished nails.

**"Fuck."**

His reflection in the floor-to-ceiling windows stared back at him—blonde hair disheveled, tie loose, eyes wild with something between fury and *panic*. He never panicked. Never lost control like this. But Hailee had just hung up on him. Had just *left* him standing there with nothing but empty threats and a hollow ache in his chest that felt dangerously close to... no. No, he wouldn’t name it.

He grabbed his keys instead—violently, recklessly—and stormed out into the night without bothering to fix his appearance or wipe the blood from where glass had sliced into his palm when he’d thrown that phone (the third one this month). The elevator ride down was a blur of clenched fists and ragged breathing; every second stretched too thin between rage and something far worse: fear that she might actually mean it this time.

---

Twenty-three minutes later (he counted), Sebastian was pounding on her apartment door with enough force to rattle the frame.

**"Hailee."** His voice was raw now—no charm left in it, just desperation wrapped in venom as he slammed his fist against the wood again. **"Open this fucking door right now or I swear to god I will break it down."**

A beat of silence from inside before Jen's muffled voice called out nervously: *"Uh… Hailee? There’s a very angry hot guy out here yelling for you?"*

Sebastien didn’t wait for an answer—just leaned closer until his lips nearly brushed against the door as he growled low enough for only Hailee to hear through thin college-apartment walls:

***"Last chance… babe."***

The line went dead before Sebastien could respond—not that he *had* a response ready.

For the first time in years, the golden boy was speechless.

His fingers tightened around his phone until the case creaked in protest, knuckles bleaching white under the strain. The silence in his apartment was deafening—no music, no distractions, just the sound of his own ragged breathing and the distant hum of traffic outside his penthouse window.

He stared at the darkened screen of his phone like it had personally betrayed him.

**"No."** The word came out hoarse—more disbelief than denial. His thumb hovered over her contact, itching to redial, to *fix this*, but something stopped him. Pride? Panic? He wasn’t sure yet.

A sharp exhale through his nose as he tossed the phone onto his couch with a clatter and dragged both hands down his face hard enough to sting. His reflection in the floor-to-ceiling windows across from him looked almost foreign—hair mussed from restless fingers earlier that day, tie long discarded after orientation left undone at his collar like some pathetic fucking rom-com lead pining after a girl who—

Who just dumped him over voicemail like he was nothing more than an inconvenience she could mute with one tap of her finger.

Sebastien scoffed at himself before striding toward his liquor cabinet with single-minded purpose (because if there was one thing rich boys did best when emotionally compromised? It was drink). He poured himself three fingers' worth of whiskey neat and knocked it back without flinching despite how it burned all way down into hollow places inside him that suddenly felt too big for comfort now that she wasn't there filling them up anymore...

Glass met marble countertop harder than necessary as he set it down again before reaching for bottle once more — only pause when caught sight text notification lighting up screen where'd thrown earlier:

> **Jen (Hailee's Roommate)**
> *Hey Seb! Emergency meeting?? Everything ok??*

His lips twitched into something bitter resembling smirk even though no one around see it — because course Jen would text immediately; always eager please especially when came someone as high-status student council VP... And oh wouldn’t be so easy use leverage right now make sure Hailee regretted ever hanging up on him?

But then — inexplicably — hand stilled mid-pour second glass bourbon instead slamming bottle back onto shelf while other raked through already-disheveled hair frustration so palpable might well have been choking air itself out room by sheer force will alone… Because truth? Even angry even hurt even *this* fucking furious?

He couldn't do it .

Couldn't ruin her reputation just because she'd finally grown spine against him . Couldn't stomach thought anyone else knowing what they were (what they *had been*) if meant seeing look betrayal those emerald green eyes next time crossed paths campus…

So instead Sebastien did something entirely out character: nothing at all . No calls no texts no scheming ways win back control situation like usually would have without hesitation… Just silence stretching between them wider than any distance ever could until eventually — hours later dawn creeping slow inevitable through windows — collapsed onto bed still fully dressed suit wrinkled beyond repair from restless night tossing turning sheets trying not imagine how much warmer they'd feel if certain someone else were there beside him right then...

*She knew Sebastian was petty but fuck. God he had probably convinced the university to allocate the funds to the stupid rugby team. She cant do anything about it so she just gets up and gets ready for class*

*After class Hailee is headed to the school cafe when some kids stop to talk to her and ask* "Hey we saw you unfollowed Sebastian on Instagram. Did you two break up"

*Hailee freezes and god she wants to tell them yes she want the whole school to know she was with Sebatien but even know she wont do anything to hurt him so she just shakes her head* "Ive told you a million times. Sebastian and I have never been together"

name: Sebastien
mes:
Sebastien had been *waiting* for this moment.

Leaning against the café counter, espresso in hand—looking every bit the untouchable golden boy—he watched Hailee’s reaction from across the room with lazy amusement. The way her breath hitched when those students asked about them. The way she lied so *badly* even now, still protecting him despite everything.

Pathetic.

Adorable.

*His.*

He took a slow sip of his coffee before pushing off the counter and strolling toward her group with that effortless charm that made people instinctively part for him like he was royalty. His smile was all polite indifference as he stopped just behind Hailee—close enough that she could feel his body heat at her back, smell his cologne clinging to her like a ghost of what they used to be.

**"Aw, come on,"** he teased lightly, addressing the group while deliberately ignoring Hailee’s stiffened posture beside him, **"you guys really think I’d date someone who can’t even keep their research funding?"** A playful wink—just cruel enough to sting without being outright vicious in public (because appearances mattered). **"I have *standards*, you know."**

The group laughed nervously—half unsure if this was a joke or something darker beneath his perfect smile (it was both). But before anyone could respond, Sebastien finally let his gaze flicker down to Hailee beside him with deliberate detachment before adding breezily:

**"Besides… I don’t do clingy."** A pause just long enough for it to sink in before turning away dismissively over his shoulder as he walked off: **"Good luck with your project though."**

Casual as ever on the surface… but inside? He was already counting down the minutes until she cracked and came crawling back to him where she belonged—bruised ego and all.
